Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Scattering of a-particles by a thin gold foil suggests the presence of
options: positively charged nucleus at the centre of an atom
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: positively charged nucleus at the centre of an atom
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Scattering of a- Particles by a thin gold foil suggest the presence of Positively charged nucleus at the centre of an atom.Experiment was performed by Rutherford in which he allowed a beam of a- Particles to fallon a thin gold foil.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Which one of the following is not a property of the X-rays?
options: They are deflected by electric fields.
They are not deflected by magnetic fields.
They have high penetration length in matter.
Their wavelength is much smaller than that of visible light.
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: They are deflected by electric fields.
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: X-rays are not deflected by electric and magnetic field.

Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: The property of the sound waves that determines the pitch of the sound is its
Physics (Waves & Sound).explanation: The frequency of a sound wave is what your ear understands as pitch. A higher frequency sound has a higher pitch, and a lower frequency sound has a lower pitch.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: Which one of the following is not true about the image formed by a plane mirror?
options: It is of the same size as the subject.
It is formed as far behind the mirror as the object is in front.
Physics (Optics).explanation: Image formed by a plane mirror is always virtual and erect. The size of the image is equal to that of the object. The image formed is as far behind the mirror as the object is in front of it. The image is laterally inverted.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: In a periscope, the two plane mirrors are kept
options: at an angle of 60° with each other
at an angle of 45° with each other
Physics (Optics).explanation: A simple periscope is just a long tube with a mirror at each end. The mirrors are fitted into each end of the tube as shown in the figure. Hence, there are 2 plane mirrors used which are placed parallel to each other.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: If the speed of light in air is 3 ´ 108 m/s, then the speed of light in a medium of refractive index 3/2 is
Physics (Optics).explanation: Refractive index of a medium = Speed of light in air / Speed of light in medium. 3/2 = (3´108) / Speed of light in medium. Speed of light in medium = (3´108) * 2/3 = 2 × 108 m/s

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: Which one of the following types of radiation has the shortest wavelength?
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: The higher energy, shorter wavelength far UV region spans wavelengths between 91 and 200 nm. Extreme UV radiation has the shortest wavelength range and highest energies of the regions of the ultraviolet spectrum and lies on the border between UV and X-ray radiation.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: The resistivity r of a material may be expressed in units of
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: The electrical resistivity is the electrical resistance per unit length and per unit of cross-sectional area at a specified temperature. The SI unit of electrical resistivity is the ohm.metre. It is commonly represented by the Greek letter r rho.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: The electromagnetic waves, which are used for satellite communication, are
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: Radio waves are used to carry satellite signals. These waves travel at 300,000 km/s (the speed of light). Communications satellites are used to send and receive radio signals for television, phone or internet communications. Large concave reflectors called satellite dishes are normally used to send and receive these signals.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The unit of the force constant k of a spring is
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: In SI units, displacements are measured in meters (m), and forces in newtons (N or kg·m/s2). Therefore, the spring constant k, and each element of the tensor , is measured in newtons per meter (N/m), or kilograms per second squared (kg/s2).

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: If x is the temperature of a system in Kelvin and y is the temperature of the system in °C, then the correct relation between them is
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: Temperature in Kelvin = 273+ temperature in °C. Temperature in Kelvin = x (given). Temperature in °C = y (given). \ x = 273+ y

Health and Disease.subject: Health and Disease
Health and Disease.question: Which one of the following is not an epidemic disease?
Health and Disease.explanation: Elephantiasis is also known as lymphatic filariasis. It’s caused by parasitic worms, and can spread from person to person through mosquitoes. Elephantiasis causes swelling of the scrotum, legs, or breasts. Elephantiasis is considered a neglected tropical disease (NTD)

Zoology.subject: Zoology
Zoology.question: Which one of the following animals has a three-chambered heart?
Zoology.explanation: Salamander belongs to group Amphibia, which shows 3 chambered heart (two auricles and one ventricle). In the 3 chambered heart, partial mixing of blood takes place. All amphibians have three chambered heart.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: Which one of the following is the correct sequence of events during sexual reproduction in plants?
options: Seedling, formation of embryo, pollination, fertilization, division of zygote
Formation of embryo, seedling, pollination, fertilization, division of zygote
Pollination, fertilization, division of zygote, formation of embryo, seedling
Seedling, formation of embryo, division of zygote, pollination, fertilization
Botany.answer: Pollination, fertilization, division of zygote, formation of embryo, seedling
Botany.explanation:
Sequence of events of sexual reproduction in flowers are:
(1) Pollination- transfer of pollen to stigma.
(2) Fertilization- fusion of male gamete and egg cell produce zygote and fusion of polar nuclei with male gamete produce triploid endosperm.
(3) Embryo formation- zygote divides many time by mitosis and produces embryo.
(4) Seedling- embryo differentiate and becomes plumule, radicle and one or two cotyledons. Endosperm divides by mitosis to produce endosperm tissue which is food store. Integuments surrounding embryo sac forms testa (seed coat).

Biochemistry.subject: Biochemistry
Biochemistry.question: Which one of the following is the ‘energy currency’ for cellular processes?
Biochemistry.explanation: Energy is usually liberated from the ATP molecule to do work in the cell by a reaction that removes one of the phosphate-oxygen groups, leaving adenosine diphosphate (ADP). so the energy currency of the cell is ATP.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: Which one of the following is the first enzyme to mix with food in the digestive tract?
Human Physiology.explanation: Salivary amylase, present in saliva, is the first digestive enzyme that gets mixed with food in oral cavity during the process of mastication and bolus formation.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: Which one of the following is the correct sequence of organs that occur in the path of urine flow in human body?
Human Physiology.explanation: Urine transport follows a path through the kidneys, ureters, urinary, bladder and urethra.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: Which of the following endocrine glands is not found in pair in humans?
Human Physiology.explanation: Endocrineglands are a pair of testis in males and a pair of ovaries in females. Pituitary gland is the master gland that regulates the activity of other endocrine glands. Hence, pituitary gland does not exist in pairs.

Chemistry.subject: Chemistry
Chemistry.question:
Match List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the code given below the Lists :
List-I (Name)
A. Bleaching powder
B. Baking soda
C. Washing soda
D. Slaked lime
List-II (Formula)
1. NaHCO3
2. Na2CO3 × 10H2O
3. Ca(OH)2
4. CaOC12
Codes:
A B C D
(a) 4 1 2 3
(b) 4 2 1 3
(c) 3 2 1 4
(d) 3 1 2 4
Chemistry.explanation:
Bleaching Powder CaOCl2
Baking Soda NaHCO3
Washing Soda Na2CO3.10H2O
Slaked lime Ca(OH)2

Chemistry.subject: Chemistry
Chemistry.question: The number of water molecules associated with copper sulphate molecule to form crystals is
Chemistry.explanation: The copper sulphate crystals contains 5 molecules of water of crystallization. CuSO4. 5H2O which are blue in colour.

Cell Biology.subject: Cell Biology
Cell Biology.question: Which one of the following cell organelles contains DNA?
Cell Biology.explanation: The three organelles that contain DNA are the nucleus, mitochondria and chloroplasts. Organelles are membrane-bound subunits within a cell analogous to organs in the body - that perform specific functions. The nucleus is the control center of the cell, and houses genetic information.

History of Science.subject: History of Science
History of Science.question: Who among the following scientists introduced the concept of immunization to the medical world?
History of Science.explanation: In 1798 Edward Jenner introduced inoculation with cowpox (smallpox vaccine), a much safer procedure. This procedure, referred to as vaccination, gradually replaced smallpox inoculation, now called variolation to distinguish it from vaccination. Until the 1880s vaccine/vaccination referred only to smallpox, but Louis Pasteur developed immunization methods for chicken cholera and anthrax in animals and for human rabies, and suggested that the terms vaccine/vaccination should be extended to cover the new procedures. This can cause confusion if care is not taken to specify which vaccine is used e.g. measles vaccine or influenza vaccine.
